new_messages.content: Please analyze and update today's (2025-10-08 12:00:00) positions.

The current positions and their open prices are:
- NVDA: $187.91 (8 shares)
- AMZN: $224.25 (5 shares)
- META: $717.90 (1 share)

### Market Sentiment and News:
1. **NVDA (NVIDIA)**:
   - Reddit discussions highlight NVIDIA as a foundational player in the AI boom, suggesting it has strong staying power even if the AI bubble bursts.
   - No recent negative sentiment found.

2. **AMZN (Amazon)**:
   - Amazon is also mentioned as a survivor in the AI bubble scenario, indicating resilience.
   - No recent negative sentiment found.

3. **META (Meta/Facebook)**:
   - Reddit posts discuss user frustrations with account suspensions and Meta's policies, but this doesn't directly impact stock performance.
   - No major negative sentiment affecting stock value.

### Portfolio Valuation:
- **NVDA**: 8 shares × $187.91 = $1,503.28
- **AMZN**: 5 shares × $224.25 = $1,121.25
- **META**: 1 share × $717.90 = $717.90
- **Total Stock Value**: $1,503.28 + $1,121.25 + $717.90 = $3,342.43
- **Cash**: $1,655.18
- **Total Portfolio Value**: $3,342.43 + $1,655.18 = $4,997.61

### Next Steps:
Given the positive sentiment and strong fundamentals for NVDA and AMZN, and no immediate red flags for META, I recommend holding these positions. If you'd like to rebalance or explore other opportunities, let me know.

URL: https://www.reddit.com/r/ArtificialInteligence/comments/1o0ijds/if_the_ai_bubble_bursts_which_companies_actually/
Subreddit: r/ArtificialInteligence
Title: If the AI bubble bursts, which companies actually survive — like Amazon did after the dot-com crash?
Author: u/WildWatercress8665
Score: 129 | Comments: 350 | Upvote Ratio: 80.0%
Created: 2025-10-07 23:49:39
Content: The AI boom feels a lot like the late ’90s internet frenzy — huge innovation, but insane hype. When this bubble pops, 90% of tools and startups will vanish.

But some players are *too foundational to die*. My shortlist of survivors:
**OpenAI, Microsoft, NVIDIA, Google, Amazon, Hugging Face, Anthropic, Databricks, Mistral/Cohere, and Pinecone.**

These are either infrastructure (compute, data, models) or so deeply integrated into daily workflows that they’re basically utility layers.

What do you think? Which AI companies have *real staying power* — and which ones are just riding the wave?
================================================================================


================================================================================
URL: https://www.reddit.com/r/facebook/comments/1o00g4s/if_you_have_an_active_facebook_account_still/
Subreddit: r/facebook
Title: If you have an active facebook account still please read this so you don’t lose yours if you get suspended. DO NOT CLICK ON THE BLUE APPEAL BUTTON!!
Author: u/jkrobinson1979
Score: 680 | Comments: 350 | Upvote Ratio: 95.0%
Created: 2025-10-07 08:37:12
Content: I lost an old alt account for one of the BS reasons Meta has been given a few weeks ago. Within 2 days I received the same suspension notice on my 18 year old main account because of account integrity and being associated with  the other account. But I didn’t click appeal because they usually are disabled quickly and my IG would also get shut down. Instead I’ve spent the last couple weeks trying to find answers.

Out of sheer frustration I clicked on the app and saw the suspension page with the days ticking down. I randomly clicked on the Help option in the top right corner and asked them to do an account check. Within 10 minutes I checked back and they walked me through several steps including deleting old emails or phone numbers associated with the account and deleting posts and comments which perhaps FB found to be questionable (they weren’t). I did all that and then created my new password and viola, back in.

I’ll have to update this if it actually allows me to stay, but for now this method seems to work better than the Appeal option.

EDIT: I realize Facebook and meta suck and already didn’t spend a lot of time there, but many of us have decades old accounts with friends and family who aren’t going to be switching to new platforms anytime soon. It’s not always just so easy as “fuck meta”. So save yourself the time commenting on that.
================================================================================
